questions.question: What is a nested query in SQL?
options: A query that uses aggregate functions
A query embedded within the WHERE clause of another query
A query that updates multiple tables
questions.answer: A query embedded within the WHERE clause of another query

questions.question: What does the EXISTS function check in SQL?
options: If a table exists in the database
If a column exists in a table
If a correlated nested query returns any rows
If two tables are related by a foreign key
questions.answer: If a correlated nested query returns any rows

questions.question: Which SQL clause is used to group rows that share the same values in specified columns?
What is the purpose of the HAVING clause in SQL?
options: To filter individual rows in a query
To filter groups of rows after applying aggregate functions
questions.answer: To filter groups of rows after applying aggregate functions

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT an aggregate function in SQL?
What does the term 'trigger' refer to in SQL?
options: A procedure that starts automatically when a specified event occurs
A constraint that enforces referential integrity
A query that updates multiple tables
A schema for defining database tables
questions.answer: A procedure that starts automatically when a specified event occurs

questions.question: Which keyword is used to create a trigger in SQL?
What is a view in SQL?
options: A temporary table used for intermediate data storage
A virtual table derived from other tables
questions.answer: A virtual table derived from other tables

questions.question: Which SQL command is used to define a view?
What is the difference between an updatable view and a non-updatable view?
options: An updatable view allows SELECT queries only, while a non-updatable view allows all DML operations
An updatable view can modify data in the base table, while a non-updatable view cannot
An updatable view contains aggregate functions, while a non-updatable view does not
An updatable view cannot reference multiple tables, while a non-updatable view can
questions.answer: An updatable view can modify data in the base table, while a non-updatable view cannot

questions.question: Which of the following clauses is NOT allowed in an updatable view?
What does the WITH CHECK OPTION clause ensure in a view?
options: The view is created with a unique constraint
Only valid data that satisfies the view condition can be inserted or updated
The view can only be used for SELECT queries
The view is automatically updated when the base table changes
questions.answer: Only valid data that satisfies the view condition can be inserted or updated

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using SQL triggers?
options: They enable automatic execution of actions on specific database events
questions.answer: They enable automatic execution of actions on specific database events

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a valid trigger event in SQL?
What is a correlated nested query?
options: A query that references an attribute from an outer query
A query with multiple aggregate functions
A query that joins more than two tables
A query that retrieves unique rows
questions.answer: A query that references an attribute from an outer query
